title: Man injured in accidental Crestview shooting
content:
CRESTVIEW, Fla. (WEAR) —
Investigators with the Crestview Police Department are looking into a shooting that happened in the 400 block of Triton Street around 3:45 p.m. on Wednesday.
The 54-year-old victim told officers that he had been cleaning his personal handgun when he "observed a malfunction with the spring, and attempted to clear it by pulling back on the slide."
Authorities say that's when the gun went off and fired a round in his groin, through his leg and exited his buttocks.
The victim called for his adult son who drove him to North Okaloosa Medical Center for treatment.
Officials are continuing to investigate, but do not believe the victim purposefully shot himself and are currently considering the shooting as accidental.
This incident has no relation to a second shooting that happened in the Fox Valley subdivision three hours later that same day, according to the Crestview Police Department.
